about_the_game:
Labyrinthatunes is the official soundtrack of the retro-futuristic puzzle adventure collectathon game, Labyrinthatory. The soundtrack features music for all 15 areas of the game, including puzzle theme versions; all menus; five national-culture-inspired tracks (including puzzle themes) for the dining room area; all Robot Rockers tracks; Atrium themes; end-of-game themes; and short themes that play throughout the game.

The soundtrack can be classified as "easy listening" as most of the themes are designed to accompany the player's exploration and puzzle solving. The music is great for studying, working, driving, and exercising.

The songs were scored and produced using FL Studio (including extensions and plug-ins), free-and-open source audio files, and Bosca Ceoil (for the arcade game themes). There are no high-quality audio files because the songs were composed to sound retro and synthesized, thus mitigating high-quality sound loss in the MP3 files.

We hope you enjoy Labyrinthatunes and the game the tracks are from, Labyrinthatory!

All music created by Tom Ballard and Erika Luke (with some help from Bach, Beethoven, Mussorgsky, Sousa, and Joplin, may they rest in peace).

name: Labyrinthatunes: Labyrinthatory Soundtrack
short_description: Check out the soundtrack for Labyrinthatory, Labyrinthatunes, featuring all audio tracks from the game! Composed in a retro and synthesized style, the soundtrack's easy listening vibe is great for studying, working, driving, or whatever you do.
